title: Furious dad slams teachers for banning daughter from school photo over red hair
text:

A furious father has slammed a school for banning his daughter from pictures over red streaks in her hair.

Marian Scott, eight, was allegedly told she wouldn't be able to take part in the school photos at Paragon Charter Academy in Jackson, Michigan, U.S.A.

Her father Doug Scott said Marian was left in tears for being 'singled out'.

Doug said: "All of this is uncalled for, they didn't even call us.

"Marian didn't leave the house, go on the street and get this done on her own, no - she's eight years old, we did this ourselves in our own home and there's no way I felt like this would happen."

(Image: News 10/WILX)

(Image: News 10/WILX)

Doug said he was angry at the fact the school did not contact the parents to raise the issue and advise them to change the hair before the school pictures, reports WILX10.

He added: "If they would have reached out to us and say come get her...she's got a hair issue, we need you to change it, that's not allowed - I would have been fine with why this happened but they didn't reach out to us."

The dad also questioned why she was allowed to remain in her classes with red hair but not take part in the group photo.

(Image: News 10/WILX)

Marian will now get her picture taken on a re-take day on November 12 after her parents changed the hair.

The Paragon Charter Academy handbook says that students' hair colour must be natural tones to get their picture taken.

It said a recorded message was sent to parents the Sunday before photos were taken which clearly set out the dress code policy.

Principal Ben Kriesch added students with a hair colour or style violation are given a week or so to get it corrected, which is why Marian was allowed to remain in lessons.
description: Marian Scott, eight, was allegedly told she wouldn't be able to take part in the school photos as only 'natural tones' of hair colour were allowed
